intro: Meibomia variifolia, commonly known as the variable leaf meibomia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that vary in shape, giving it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Meibomia variifolia is often found in open woodlands and along rocky outcrops, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
